channel.title: Journals on FalconBlog
channel.description: Recent content in Journals on FalconBlog

item.title: Day 21
item.description:
January 21, 2025 - Productivity and Realizations üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüìö Morning Classes: A Mixed Bag üéì

Digital Systems (8 AM):
    Another stellar lecture! 10/10, this subject keeps delivering value every time.
Physics:
    Consistently underwhelming at 6/10; nothing new here.
Signals & Systems:
    A bit better, sitting at 6.5/10, as usual.
Mathematics:
    Hit rock bottom today. 4/10‚Äîcouldn‚Äôt connect with the class at all.
    Ended up using the time to self-study with a textbook during class.

Afternoon Focus Time at the Library üìö

item.title: Day 20
item.description:
**January 20, 2025 - A Day of Classes, Productivity, and Raspberry Pi Experimentation

Classes: First Impressions & Highlights üéì

Digital Systems:
    As expected, it was amazing and insightful. This class never disappoints!
Physics:
    First lecture today, rated it 6/10. Seems okay so far, but let's see how it progresses.
Signals & Systems:
    Another first, rated slightly better at 6.5/10. Some interesting concepts but room for more engagement.
Digital Systems Lab:
    First session was more administrative:
        Introduced the logistics, grading scheme, and lab organization.
        Got to know our lab partners.
        Collected the kits, which look promising for future experiments.

Afternoon: Productivity Mode ‚öôÔ∏è

item.title: Day 19
item.description:
January 19, 2025 - A Mix of Music, Family, and Robotics

Morning: Musical Pursuits üéπ

  • Spent time learning a basic keyboard version of Interstellar’s theme.
  • It was my first attempt at playing this iconic piece, and though simple, it felt magical to bring the music to life.

Afternoon: Chess Battles ‚ôüÔ∏è

  • Played multiple rounds of chess with my roommates.
  • It was a fun and engaging experience, sharpening strategic thinking while enjoying the camaraderie.

Evening: Family Time & Feast üç≤

  • Relatives visited me after a long time, bringing a mountain of snacks to enjoy at the hostel. It felt heartwarming to reconnect with them.
  • Dinner was exceptionally good, making the evening even better.

Night: ROS2 Setup Struggles ü§ñ

  • Tried hard to set up ROS2 on the Raspberry Pi. Despite spending considerable time, I haven’t successfully completed it yet.

Reflection

Today had a balance of leisure, reconnecting with loved ones, and tackling technical challenges. Though the ROS2 setup isn‚Äôt done, I‚Äôm learning through the process. Days like these make the journey more memorable.

item.title: Day 18
item.description:
January 18, 2025 - Robotics Challenges and Triumphs

Morning & Afternoon: Endless Debugging

Continued working with the Raspberry Pi 4 and TurtleBot:

  • Spent a tiring morning flashing, reflashing, corrupting, and recorrupting the memory card. It felt like an endless cycle, testing my patience at every step.
  • Ran into several frustrating issues with storage integrity, but kept pushing through.

Evening: Progress Made

All the effort paid off!

  • Successfully set up teleoperation (teleop) for the TurtleBot, allowing me to manually control its movement.
  • Achieved autodock functionality, enabling it to autonomously return to its charging dock.

The sense of accomplishment was immense, and all the hard work felt worth it in the end.

item.title: Day 17
item.description:
January 17, 2025 - Classes, Books, and Robotics

Morning: Classes Begin

  • 8 AM: First HS class, but the professor didn‚Äôt show up. A bit of a slow start to the day.
  • Made productive use of the time by borrowing all required books for the semester from the library. Stocked up and ready to go!
  • 10 AM - Math class: Not very engaging. Rated it a 5/10‚Äîhoping for better classes ahead.
  • 11 AM - Digital Systems: Absolutely loved the class! The professor‚Äôs strong industry experience and confident teaching style stood out. Rated it a 10/10‚Äîexcited for more!

Afternoon: Exploring Raspberry Pi 4 and TurtleBot

Finally began working hands-on with the Raspberry Pi 4 and TurtleBot.

item.title: Day 16
item.description:
January 16, 2025 - Puzzles, Programming, and Progress

Morning: Challenging Calendar Puzzle

Kicked off the day by solving the daily calendar puzzle. This one was exceptionally tough, but I powered through, and the satisfaction of cracking it was worth the effort!

Afternoon: Cancelled Classes and Good Food

  • Surprisingly, all my classes were cancelled today. This gave me plenty of time to focus on other priorities.
  • The mess meals were actually good today‚Äîdefinitely a bonus for the day.
  • Visited the IE lab to complete my course enrollment verification, ensuring everything is squared away for the semester.

Evening: Codeforces and Problem Sheets

Spent the entire evening immersed in competitive programming on Codeforces. Followed handpicked problem sheets, tackling specific challenges and learning new techniques along the way. C++ is starting to feel more natural!

item.title: Day 15
item.description:
January 15, 2025 - A Day of Exploration and Success

Morning: Competitive Programming with C++

The day began with some Codeforces practice as I ventured into learning C++. Coming from C, it was refreshing to explore the speed and syntax of C++. Although the learning curve is a bit steep, the efficiency is worth it!

Afternoon: Essentials, Registration Success, and Good Food

  • Bought some essentials from PrimeMart, preparing for the semester’s start.
  • After multiple attempts in workflow, I finally registered for a humanities elective. Persistence paid off, and it feels like a win. üéâ
  • Had my meals at the Himalaya Food Court, making use of the last day of meal coupons before they expired. It was a delightful change from the usual menu.

Evening: Sweet Reunions and Solving Puzzles

  • Reconnected with returning friends who came back to campus. They brought delicious sweets, which were much appreciated‚Äîa perfect treat for wrapping up the day.
  • Spent time solving the daily calendar puzzle, and after a significant effort, the eureka moment felt very rewarding!

Night: Diving into Neural Networks and Transformers

The night was all about expanding my knowledge base. I researched:

item.title: Day 14
item.description:
January 14, 2025 - A Productive Day & Starting Semester 2 Preparations

Today was a blend of studies, planning, and tidying up for the start of Semester 2.

Morning: Studies in Linear Algebra

I spent a lot of time studying some important concepts in linear algebra:

  • Rank-Nullity Theorem
  • Solvability of Linear Systems
  • Linear Transformations and Basis
  • Change of Basis Matrix

These are all building blocks that will definitely come in handy as I progress in my courses, especially with the upcoming Semester 2.

item.title: Day 13
item.description:
January 13, 2025 - Perfect Square, Perfect Day!

Today was truly a whirlwind of emotions and excitement, giving me strong hints that 2025, although an odd year, might just be a spectacular one. Maybe it‚Äôs because 2025 is a perfect square‚Äîa year of balance and awesomeness (or so I‚Äôd like to think). Here’s how my amazing day unfolded: Supercopa Drama: Real Madrid vs. Barcelona

The day started with an epic late-night clash in the Supercopa final between Real Madrid and Barcelona. Talk about entertainment!

item.title: Day 12
item.description:
January 12, 2025 - Saarang Day 3: Mixed Vibes and Rocking Nights

Today was a whirlwind of emotions, experiences, and energy as I continued soaking in the vibes of Saarang Fest 2025. Here’s how it unfolded:

CTF Disappointment

The day started with high hopes as I participated in the IIT Kanpur Web3-based CTF, but it turned out to be a letdown. Honestly, it didn‚Äôt even feel like a proper CTF. The focus was more on programming questions, and they didn‚Äôt even provide the full test cases for the challenges, which made it frustrating to solve. After a couple of attempts, I lost interest and decided not to bother proceeding further.

item.title: Day 11
item.description:
January 11, 2025 - A Day of Cultural Thrills, Secret Adventures, and Football Frenzy

Today was an exciting rollercoaster of experiences, packed with cultural festivities, sporting spirit, and some intriguing classified adventures. Here‚Äôs how my day unfolded:

Fixing Gazebo Issues

I started the day resolving the persistent Gazebo simulation errors. After spending time troubleshooting, I discovered that the issue stemmed from mismatched file paths in the scripts and the actual directory. Thankfully, after making the necessary corrections, the simulation was finally up and running smoothly. Fixing this was a huge relief and a great start to the day.

item.title: Day 10
item.description:
January 10, 2025 - A Day Full of Learning, Action, and Inspiration

Today was a perfect blend of progress in technical skills and unforgettable experiences at the Saarang cultural fest. Here‚Äôs how my day unfolded:

LeetCode & CTF Progress

I started the day with some problem-solving on LeetCode, tackling a couple of interesting questions, including a binary tree search problem that used recursive iteration. It was a fantastic challenge that made me appreciate the elegance of recursion in binary tree algorithms.

item.title: Day 9
item.description:
January 9, 2025 - A Carnival of Culture and Creativity

Today marked Day 0 of Saarang, our much-awaited cultural fest, and it was a day brimming with excitement, camaraderie, and awe-inspiring experiences.

Exploring Stalls: A Vibrant Start

The day kicked off with a visit to the fest stalls alongside my friends.

  • There were countless food stalls, far more than we had during our tech fest. The aromas and diversity of flavors were captivating.
  • Other stalls showcased aesthetic items, rings, accessories, and exclusive merchandise that added to the festival charm.
  • Book lovers were not left out, with bookstalls lining the lanes, offering treasures for the avid reader.
  • I also noticed preparations for a carnival-like atmosphere, with towering structures like a Ferris wheel and huge swings being built. The festive energy was undeniable!

Drama and Theatrics: Performances That Inspire

Next, I headed to the CLT Lawns (Central Lecture Theatre) to witness a drama competition featuring performances from various colleges.

item.title: Day 8
item.description:
January 8, 2025 - A Day of Exploration in ROS2

Today was a self-paced and highly productive day as I took a deep dive into the world of Robot Operating System 2 (ROS2). Without any scheduled events or workshops, I focused on expanding my robotics knowledge and experimenting hands-on with new concepts.

Building ROS2 Nodes

My primary goal was to enhance my understanding of ROS2 by creating custom publisher and subscriber nodes. I used my laptop’s webcam to verify their functionality, and the experiment was a success! The subscriber node processed real-time data from the webcam, while the publisher efficiently relayed the output. This reinforced my understanding of ROS2’s core architecture and messaging mechanisms.

item.title: Day 7
item.description:
January 7, 2025 - A Day of Cybersecurity, Celebrations, and Comfort

Today was an exciting journey of learning and preparation, offering a perfect balance between intellectual challenges and personal organization. Ethical Hacking Workshop: Unveiling Cyber Secrets

The day began with a fascinating Ethical Hacking Workshop that featured two in-depth sessions:

Session 1 (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM): Focused on the basics of ethical hacking, emphasizing methodologies and tools used to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities.
Session 2 (2:00 PM - 5:00 PM): Took a deeper dive into advanced hacking techniques, offering hands-on exercises to strengthen our understanding of cyber defense mechanisms.

The workshop wasn‚Äôt just about learning to break into systems but understanding how to protect them. It was both enlightening and empowering. Diving Into CTF Challenges

item.title: Day 6
item.description:
January 6, 2025 - A Day of Insights, Entertainment, and Delights

Blockchain Workshop: Learning the Technology of Tomorrow

The day began with a highly informative Blockchain Workshop that spanned across two engaging sessions:

Session 1 (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM): Focused on the fundamentals of blockchain technology, its architecture, and applications.
Session 2 (2:00 PM - 5:00 PM): Built on the foundation laid earlier, diving into smart contracts and decentralized applications. The workshop provided a great mix of theory and hands-on experience, helping me gain a clearer perspective on blockchain's immense potential.

Spectacular Envisage Show at the SAC

item.title: Day 5
item.description:
January 5, 2025 - A Day of Learning, Exploration, and Celebration

Focused Study on Vector Spaces

The day began with an intense 90-minute math session, during which I delved deeper into topics related to vector spaces.

  • Key Learnings: Linear dependence, linear combination, span of a vector subspace, and their core properties.
  • Resources Used: Referred to multiple books from our library and supplemented the reading with NPTEL lectures for added clarity. This session helped solidify my conceptual understanding of the subject.

Stall Exploration and Puzzle Challenges

In the afternoon, I decided to unwind a bit by exploring the event stalls on campus.

item.title: Day 4
item.description:
January 4, 2025 - A Day of IoT, Linear Algebra, and Electrifying Robotics

IoT Workshop - Raspberry Pi
The day kicked off with an inspiring IoT workshop centred around the versatile Raspberry Pi. Split into two sessions:

  • Morning (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM): We explored foundational IoT concepts and set up the Raspberry Pi for various applications.
  • Afternoon (2:00 PM - 5:00 PM): This session focused on real-world IoT projects and experimentation, which deepened my understanding and excitement for this growing field.

Library Study Time: Vector Spaces and Subspaces
From 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM, I tucked myself away in the library for a focused study session on vector spaces and subspaces in linear algebra. The clarity I gained during this time was immensely satisfying.

item.title: Day 3
item.description:
Today’s Progress - January 3, 2025

  • Successfully Passed Driving Test: Thrilled to have earned my driving license today! It was an amazing experience, and all the practice finally paid off.

  • Boarded Train and Met Classmate: During the journey, I caught up with a classmate. We had an enriching discussion and learned more about neural networks, Support Vector Machines (SVM), and tools like Zettelkasten in Obsidian.

  • Arrived at Campus: Got picked up by my cousin upon arrival, reached IIT Madras, and settled into my room.

item.title: Day 2
item.description:
Today’s Progress - January 2, 2025

  • Final Driving Lesson in the Morning: Completed the final driving lesson today in preparation for tomorrow‚Äôs driving test. Feeling confident and excited about earning my license approval.

  • Last-Minute Packing: Finished all last-minute packing for the journey back to campus. Ensured that everything is organized and ready for a smooth transition.

  • Quality Time with Mom and Dad: Spent meaningful moments with my parents as they gave me their final thoughts and advice before I leave for the semester. Grateful for their support and encouragement.

item.title: Day 1
item.description:
Today’s Progress:

  • Completed ROS 2 4-wheeled robot simulation in Gazebo: Spent time configuring and simulating a robot model using Gazebo. It was an exciting hands-on experience, and I’m glad to see it working.

  • Set up my journal for the new year: Dedicated some time today to create a fresh journal layout for 2025. This will help keep my daily progress and thoughts organized for the upcoming semester.

  • Shifted my laptop: Moved everything from my old system to my new one, ensuring that all my data and files are ready for the next phase of work. Everything‚Äôs now set up for easy access when I return to campus.
